alert.note: Alert for Eastern Sierra Slopes of Inyo County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Avalanche Watch issued March 13 at 6:55AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The Eastern Sierra Avalanche Center in Mammoth Lakes has issued a Backcountry Avalanche Watch for the following areas: the Eastern Sierra in Mono County and the Eastern Sierra in Inyo County * WHAT...Very dangerous avalanche conditions are expected to develop at all elevations overnight tonight. Conditions are expected to reach Warning levels by early morning on Tuesday, March 14th. * WHERE...The eastern slopes of the Sierra Nevada mountain range between Virgina Lakes on the north to Bishop Creek on the south. * WHEN...In effect until 7 AM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS..Intense snowfall, rain on snow at lower elevations, and strong winds will overload the snowpack, which contains buried persistent weak layers. Travel will be difficult and very dangerous. Expect widespread areas of unstable snow. * PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...Travel in avalanche terrain is not recommended. Avalanches may run long distances, into mature forests, valley floors or flat terrain. Consult http://www.esavalanche.org or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Sierra Slopes of Inyo County
